feed.title: Open Bitcoin Privacy Protect Privacy Questionnaire, Mid-Year 2015 report

entry.title: Open Bitcoin Privacy Protect Privacy Questionnaire, Mid-Year 2015 report
entry.summary: In the context provided, Kristov provides answers to questions related to Bitcoin-Qt's transaction formatting, mixing, donations, balance queries and TX broadcasting, network privacy, physical access, custodianship, telemetry data, and source code and building. The information provided includes insights into how Bitcoin-Qt handles non-mixing transactions, the use of algorithms for ordering inputs and outputs in a transaction, and the implementation of BIP 62. Kristov also discusses how Bitcoin-Qt obtains balance information, connects to known endpoints, and uses passwords/PINs to protect user data. Additionally, the responses address the ability to compile the application using a deterministic build system.
